Cancer.title_cn: 尿苷敏感性筛选鉴定出脱甲氧基辅酶Q和NUDT5为核苷酸合成的调控因子
Cancer.abstract_cn: 快速增殖的细胞需要大量的核苷酸，这使得核苷酸代谢成为癌症、自身炎症性疾病和病毒感染的广泛利用的治疗靶点。然而，核苷酸代谢的调控机制仍未完全阐明。在此，我们揭示了从头嘧啶合成的调控因子。通过尿苷敏感性CRISPR-Cas9筛选，我们发现，在脱甲氧基辅酶Q中间体作为替代电子受体存在的情况下，辅酶Q (CoQ) 对于嘧啶合成并非必需。我们进一步报告，ADP-核糖焦磷酸酶NUDT5直接结合嘌呤合成的限速酶PPAT，从而抑制其活性并维持磷酸核糖焦磷酸 (PRPP) 库。在NUDT5缺失的情况下，过度活跃的嘌呤合成会耗尽PRPP库，从而牺牲嘧啶合成，并促进对嘌呤和嘧啶核碱基类似物的耐药性。值得注意的是，NUDT5和PPAT之间的相互作用被PRPP破坏，这突显了一种复杂的变构调控机制。总而言之，我们的研究结果揭示了核苷酸平衡的基本机制，并将NUDT5定位为核碱基类似物代谢的调控因子。尿苷敏感性CRISPR-Cas9筛选鉴定出脱甲氧基辅酶Q在CoQ缺失时作为替代电子受体，并揭示NUDT5通过与PPAT的相互作用调控从头嘧啶合成。

Cancer.title: A computational approach for perturbation-induced EMT transitions
Cancer.summary: npj Systems Biology and Applications, Published online: 13 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41540-025-00597-9A computational approach for perturbation-induced EMT transitions
Cancer.abstract: The Epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT) is a cellular state transition fundamental to development, wound healing, and cancer metastasis. The gene regulatory mechanisms underlying EMT have been extensively documented, revealing gene regulatory networks (GRNs) involving groups of mutually inhibiting transcription factors and microRNAs. Despite significant progress from both experimental and computational approaches, the details of how the EMT GRN initiates EMT in response to various external inputs is still not well understood. Here, we apply both Boolean and ordinary differential equation (ODE)-based methods to simulate a well-studied 26-node, 100-edge EMT GRN, examining its response to a wide range of single- and double-node perturbations. We evaluate the characteristics of effective EMT-inducing signals, particularly examining the amplifying role of transcriptional noise in determining the likelihood and mean transit time of an EMT. Together, these models establish a complementary framework for understanding and predicting drivers of EMT in the context of a GRN. We anticipate that this framework for a systematic study of in-silico GRN perturbations will be useful in developing increasingly accurate dynamical GRN models for various biological processes.

Cancer.title_cn: 扰动诱导上皮-间充质转化的计算方法
Cancer.abstract_cn: 上皮-间充质转化（EMT）是一种细胞状态转换，对发育、伤口愈合和癌症转移至关重要。EMT的基因调控机制已被广泛研究，揭示了涉及相互抑制的转录因子和微RNA群体的基因调控网络（GRNs）。尽管实验和计算方法都取得了显著进展，但EMT基因调控网络如何响应各种外部输入启动EMT的详细机制仍不清楚。本文中，我们采用布尔模型和常微分方程（ODE）模型模拟了一个经过充分研究的、包含26个节点和100条边的EMT基因调控网络，并考察了其对广泛的单节点和双节点扰动的响应。我们评估了有效EMT诱导信号的特征，特别考察了转录噪声在决定EMT发生可能性和平均转运时间中的放大作用。总而言之，这些模型为在基因调控网络背景下理解和预测EMT驱动因素提供了一个互补的框架。我们预期，这种用于系统性研究计算机模拟基因调控网络扰动的框架，将有助于开发针对各种生物过程的日益精确的动态基因调控网络模型。

Microbiology.title: Chemical richness and diversity of uncultivated ‘Entotheonella’ symbionts in marine sponges
Microbiology.summary: Nature Chemical Biology, Published online: 13 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41589-025-02066-0Marine sponges host bacteria that produce diverse bioactive compounds. Here, the authors conduct a large-scale metagenomic, single-bacterial and biochemical study to reveal the untapped biosynthetic potential of ‘Entotheonella’ symbionts, a talented producer taxon from microbial dark matter.
Microbiology.abstract: Marine sponges are the source of numerous bioactive natural products that serve as chemical defenses and provide pharmaceutical leads for drug development. For some of the compounds, symbiotic bacteria have been established as the actual producers. Among the known sponge symbionts, ‘Candidatus Entotheonella’ members stand out because of their abundant and variable biosynthetic gene clusters (BGCs). Here, to obtain broader insights into this producer taxon, we conduct a comparative analysis on eight sponges through metagenomic and single-bacterial sequencing and biochemical studies. The data suggest sets of biosynthetic genes that are largely unique in 14 ‘Entotheonella’ candidate species and a member of a sister lineage named ‘Candidatus Proxinella’. Four biosynthetic loci were linked in silico or experimentally to cytotoxins, antibiotics and the terpene cembrene A from corals. The results support widespread and diverse bacterial roles in the chemistry of sponges and aid the development of sustainable production methods for sponge-derived therapeutics. Marine sponges host bacteria that produce diverse bioactive compounds. Here, the authors conduct a large-scale metagenomic, single-bacterial and biochemical study to reveal the untapped biosynthetic potential of ‘Entotheonella’ symbionts, a talented producer taxon from microbial dark matter.

Microbiology.title_cn: 海洋海绵中未培养的“Entotheonella”共生体的化学多样性与丰富性
Microbiology.abstract_cn: 海洋海绵是多种生物活性天然产物的来源，这些产物既可作为化学防御物质，也为药物开发提供了药学先导化合物。对于其中一些化合物，共生细菌已被证实是其真正的生产者。在已知的海绵共生体中，“Candidatus Entotheonella”成员因其丰富且多变的生物合成基因簇（BGCs）而脱颖而出。为了更深入地了解这一生产者类群，本研究通过宏基因组学、单细菌测序和生物化学研究，对八种海绵进行了比较分析。数据表明，在14种“Entotheonella”候选物种以及一个名为“Candidatus Proxinella”的姐妹谱系成员中，存在大量独特的生物合成基因集。四个生物合成位点通过计算机模拟或实验被证实与细胞毒素、抗生素以及来自珊瑚的萜烯类化合物cembrene A相关。这些结果支持了细菌在海绵化学中广泛而多样的作用，并有助于开发海绵源治疗药物的可持续生产方法。海洋海绵宿主细菌可产生多种生物活性化合物。本研究中，作者通过大规模宏基因组学、单细菌和生物化学研究，揭示了“Entotheonella”共生体（一个来自微生物暗物质的优秀生产者类群）尚未开发的生物合成潜力。

Microbiology.title: Bin Chicken: targeted metagenomic coassembly for the efficient recovery of novel genomes
Microbiology.summary: Nature Methods, Published online: 13 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41592-025-02901-1By developing a strategy of metagenomic coassembly and prioritizing divergent marker gene sequences, Bin Chicken efficiently recovers more than 77,000 microbial genomes with high novel diversity, thereby expanding the tree of life.
Microbiology.abstract: The recovery of microbial genomes from metagenomic datasets has provided genomic representation for hundreds of thousands of species from diverse biomes. However, low-abundance microorganisms are often missed due to insufficient genomic coverage. Here we present Bin Chicken, an algorithm that substantially improves genome recovery through automated, targeted selection of metagenomes for coassembly based on shared marker gene sequences derived from raw reads. Marker gene sequences that are divergent from known reference genomes can be further prioritized, providing an efficient means of recovering highly novel genomes. Applying Bin Chicken to public metagenomes and coassembling 800 sample groups recovered 77,562 microbial genomes, including the first genomic representatives of 6 phyla, 41 classes and 24,028 species. These genomes expand the genomic tree of life and uncover a wealth of novel microbial lineages for further research. By developing a strategy of metagenomic coassembly and prioritizing divergent marker gene sequences, Bin Chicken efficiently recovers more than 77,000 microbial genomes with high novel diversity, thereby expanding the tree of life.

Microbiology.title_cn: Bin Chicken：靶向宏基因组共组装用于高效恢复新型基因组
Microbiology.abstract_cn: 从宏基因组数据集中恢复微生物基因组，为来自不同生物群落的数十万物种提供了基因组代表。然而，由于基因组覆盖度不足，低丰度微生物常常被遗漏。本文介绍了一种名为 Bin Chicken 的算法，该算法通过基于原始测序读段中共享的标记基因序列，自动、靶向选择宏基因组进行共组装，从而显著提高了基因组的恢复效率。与已知参考基因组存在差异的标记基因序列可以被进一步优先考虑，这为恢复高度新型基因组提供了一种高效手段。将 Bin Chicken 应用于公共宏基因组数据并对800个样本组进行共组装，共恢复了77,562个微生物基因组，其中包括6个门、41个纲和24,028个物种的首个基因组代表。这些基因组扩展了生命基因组之树，并揭示了大量可供进一步研究的新型微生物谱系。通过开发宏基因组共组装策略并优先考虑差异性标记基因序列，Bin Chicken 高效恢复了超过77,000个具有高度新颖多样性的微生物基因组，从而扩展了生命之树。

Virtual Cell.title: Jaxley: differentiable simulation enables large-scale training of detailed biophysical models of neural dynamics
Virtual Cell.summary: Nature Methods, Published online: 13 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41592-025-02895-wJaxley is a versatile platform for biophysical modeling in neuroscience. It allows efficiently simulating large-scale biophysical models on CPUs, GPUs and TPUs. Model parameters can be optimized with gradient descent via backpropagation of error.
Virtual Cell.abstract: Biophysical neuron models provide insights into cellular mechanisms underlying neural computations. A central challenge has been to identify parameters of detailed biophysical models such that they match physiological measurements or perform computational tasks. Here we describe a framework for simulating biophysical models in neuroscience—Jaxley—which addresses this challenge. By making use of automatic differentiation and GPU acceleration, Jaxley enables optimizing large-scale biophysical models with gradient descent. Jaxley can learn biophysical neuron models to match voltage or two-photon calcium recordings, sometimes orders of magnitude more efficiently than previous methods. Jaxley also makes it possible to train biophysical neuron models to perform computational tasks. We train a recurrent neural network to perform working memory tasks, and a network of morphologically detailed neurons with 100,000 parameters to solve a computer vision task. Jaxley improves the ability to build large-scale data- or task-constrained biophysical models, creating opportunities for investigating the mechanisms underlying neural computations across multiple scales. Jaxley is a versatile platform for biophysical modeling in neuroscience. It allows efficiently simulating large-scale biophysical models on CPUs, GPUs and TPUs. Model parameters can be optimized with gradient descent via backpropagation of error.
Virtual Cell.authors_short: Deistler, Michael et al., Macke, Jakob H.
Virtual Cell.title_cn: Jaxley：可微分模拟赋能神经动力学详细生物物理模型的大规模训练
Virtual Cell.abstract_cn: 生物物理神经元模型为神经计算背后的细胞机制提供了深入见解。一个核心挑战是确定详细生物物理模型的参数，使其与生理测量结果相符或执行计算任务。本文介绍了一个用于神经科学中生物物理模型模拟的框架——Jaxley，它解决了这一挑战。通过利用自动微分和GPU加速，Jaxley能够使用梯度下降法优化大规模生物物理模型。Jaxley可以学习生物物理神经元模型以匹配电压或双光子钙记录，其效率有时比现有方法高出几个数量级。Jaxley还使得训练生物物理神经元模型来执行计算任务成为可能。我们训练了一个循环神经网络来执行工作记忆任务，并训练了一个包含10万个参数的形态学详细神经元网络来解决计算机视觉任务。Jaxley提升了构建大规模数据或任务约束生物物理模型的能力，为研究跨多个尺度的神经计算机制创造了机会。Jaxley是一个用于神经科学中生物物理建模的多功能平台。它允许在CPU、GPU和TPU上高效模拟大规模生物物理模型。模型参数可以通过误差反向传播的梯度下降法进行优化。

Single-cell & Spatial omics.title: ScRDAVis: An R shiny application for single-cell transcriptome data analysis and visualization
Single-cell & Spatial omics.summary: by Sankarasubramanian Jagadesan, Chittibabu GudaSingle-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) technology has revolutionized biological research by enabling a through exploration of cellular heterogeneity. However, the complexity of data processing pipelines and the need for programming expertise create barriers for many biologists to explore scRNA-seq data. To address this, we developed Single-cell RNA Data Analysis and Visualization (ScRDAVis), an interactive, browser-based R Shiny application tailored for biologists with no programming expertise. ScRDAVis integrates widely used analysis packages, such asSeurat,CellChat,Monocle3,clusterProfilerandhdWGCNAto provide a user-friendly interface for single-cell data analysis. The application supports single-sample, multiple-sample and group-based analyses, along with features such as marker discovery, cell type annotation, subclustering analysis, and advanced functional studies. Key functionalities include cell-cell communication analysis, trajectory and pseudotime inference, pathway enrichment analysis, weighted gene co-expression network analysis (WGCNA), and transcription factor (TF) regulatory network analysis. ScRDAVis stands out as the first GUI-based platform offering hdWGCNA for co-expression network and TF regulatory network analysis using scRNA-seq data. ScRDAVis provides publication-ready visualizations with data download options in different formats empowering researchers to extract meaningful biological insights and democratizing the analytical capabilities required to comprehensively analyze scRNA-seq studies. ScRDAVis can be freely downloaded from GitHub at https://github.com/GudaLab/ScRDAVis or accessed from any browser at https://www.gudalab-rtools.net/ScRDAVis.

Single-cell & Spatial omics.title: Library size-stabilized metacells construction enhances co-expression network analysis in single-cell data
Single-cell & Spatial omics.summary: by Tianjiao Zhang, Haibin ZhuSingle-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) deciphers cell type-specific co-expression networks to resolve biological functions but remains constrained by data sparsity and compositional biases. Conventional metacells construction strategies mitigate sparsity by aggregating transcriptionally similar cells but often neglect systematic biases introduced by compositional data. This problem leads to spurious co-expression correlations and obscuring biologically meaningful interactions. Through mathematical modeling and simulations, we demonstrate that uncontrolled library size variance in traditional metacells inflates false-positive correlations and distorts co-expression networks. Here, we present LSMetacell (Library Size-stabilized Metacells), a computational framework that explicitly stabilizes library sizes across metacells to reduce compositional noise while preserving cellular heterogeneity. LSMetacell addresses this by stabilizing library sizes during metacells aggregation, thereby enhancing the accuracy of downstream analyses such as Weighted Gene Co-expression Network Analysis (WGCNA). Applied to a postmortem Alzheimer’s disease brain scRNA-seq dataset, LSMetacell revealed robust, cell type-specific co-expression modules enriched for disease-relevant pathways, outperforming the conventional metacells approach. Our work establishes a principled strategy for resolving compositional biases in scRNA-seq data, advancing the reliability of co-expression network inference in studying complex biological systems. This framework provides a generalizable solution for improving transcriptional analyses in single-cell studies.

Single-cell & Spatial omics.title: SpaMWGDA: Identifying spatial domains of spatial transcriptomes using multi-view weighted fusion graph convolutional network and data augmentation
Single-cell & Spatial omics.summary: by Lin Yuan, Boyuan Meng, Qingxiang Wang, Chunyu Hu, Cuihong Wang, De-Shuang HuangThe rapid development of spatial transcriptomics (ST) has made it possible to effectively integrate gene expression and spatial information of cells and accurately identify spatial domains. A large number of deep learning (DL)-based methods have been proposed to perform spatial domain identification and achieved impressive results. However, these methods have some limitations. First, these methods rely on a fixed similarity metric and cannot fully utilize neighborhood information. Second, they cannot efficiently and adaptively integrate key information when fusing and reconstructing gene expression using purely additive methods. Finally, these methods ignore key nonlinear features and introduce noise during clustering. To address these limitations, we propose a novel DL model SpaMWGDA based on multi-view weighted fused graph convolutional network (GCN) and data augmentation. By modeling spatial information using different similarity metrics, the model is able to successfully capture comprehensive neighborhood information of the spot features. By combining data augmentation and contrastive learning, SpaMWGDA is able to learn key gene expressions. SpaMWGDA uses a multi-view GCN encoder to model the similarities between spatial information and gene features, and uses a view-level attention mechanism for weighted fusion to adaptively learn the dependencies between them and learn the key features of each view. Experimental results not only demonstrate that SpaMWGDA outperforms competing methods in spatial domain identification and trajectory inference but also show the ability of SpaMWGDA to analyse tissue structure and function. The source code for SpaMWGDA is available at https://github.com/nathanyl/SpaMWGDA .

Single-cell & Spatial omics.abstract_cn: 空间转录组 (ST) 技术的快速发展，使得有效整合细胞基因表达和空间信息并准确识别空间域成为可能。大量基于深度学习 (DL) 的方法已被提出用于空间域识别，并取得了显著成果。然而，这些方法存在一些局限性。首先，它们依赖固定的相似性度量，无法充分利用邻域信息。其次，当使用纯加性方法融合和重构基因表达时，它们无法高效自适应地整合关键信息。最后，这些方法忽略了关键的非线性特征，并在聚类过程中引入了噪声。为解决这些局限性，我们提出了一种基于多视图加权融合图卷积网络 (GCN) 和数据增强的新型深度学习模型 SpaMWGDA。通过使用不同的相似性度量对空间信息进行建模，该模型能够成功捕获斑点特征的全面邻域信息。通过结合数据增强和对比学习，SpaMWGDA 能够学习关键的基因表达。SpaMWGDA 利用多视图 GCN 编码器对空间信息和基因特征之间的相似性进行建模，并采用视图级注意力机制进行加权融合，以自适应地学习它们之间的依赖关系并提取每个视图的关键特征。实验结果不仅表明 SpaMWGDA 在空间域识别和轨迹推断方面优于现有竞争方法，还展示了其分析组织结构和功能的能力。SpaMWGDA 的源代码可在 https://github.com/nathanyl/SpaMWGDA 获取。
